abstract: Ford Models, in response to a story being published tomorrow in Thursday Styles that discusses the progress of a fashion industry campaign to protect models through various measures, said the company had not actually agreed to a specific proposal not to allow models under the age of 16 to appear in runway shows.
lead_paragraph: Ford Models, in response to an article being published on Thursday in Thursday Styles that discusses the progress of a fashion industry campaign to protect models through various measures, said the company had not actually agreed to a specific proposal not to allow models under the age of 16 to appear in runway shows. Ford was among a dozen agencies that were listed in a press release from the Council of Fashion Designers of America last month as having "pledged that they will not send out models under the age of 16 for shows."

headline.main: Ford Acknowledges Using Models Who Are Under 16
